The 2022 Viking Touchdown Club Golf Event: 2-Person Scramble
Friday, March 18, 2022
1:00 PM
4:00 PM
Francis Lake Golf Club
5366 Golf Drive
Lake Park, GA, 31636
United States
(map)
Google Calendar
ICS
This event will kick-off with a 1 p.m. shotgun start. We will be having a shoot-out for the top 4 teams to determine the winners. The course will be closed after 9 a.m. Pick up your entry form in The Pro Shop or call Steve Davis (241-1515). This event fills up fast, so get your entry form and sign-up now.

Ladies’ Golf Association March Event
Saturday, March 19, 2022
9:30 AM
3:30 PM
Google Calendar
ICS
The ladies’ monthly tournament will be held on Saturday, March 19 with tee times starting at 9:30 a.m. The format will be an individual low gross / low net with a blind draw from the men’s event. This should be a fun tournament, so please sign up in The Pro Shop. The course will remain open for regular play during this event.

Men's Golf Association Finale Event
Saturday, October 24, 2020
8:00 AM
12:00 PM
Google Calendar
ICS
The MGA Finale will have tee times starting at 8am. The event will be Flighted with Gross and Net Flights and will be the biggest event f the year. Members of the MGA can sign up in The Pro Shop until 12pm on Friday, 10/23.
There are two pots to play for this year. The first is the original gift certificate giveaway paying everyone in the tournament. The second pot is the cash giveaway for all MGA members that have played a minimum of 7 MGA tournaments throughout the year.

Thursday, March 10, 2022
12:00 PM
4:00 PM
Francis Lake Golf Club
5366 Golf Drive
Lake Park, GA, 31636
United States
(map)
Google Calendar
ICS
The Masonic Lodge Tournament will be held on Thursday, March 10 with a 1:00 p.m. shotgun start. They will feed all players at 12 p.m. The format is a 4-person scramble with gross and net prizes. If you would like to play, please sign up your team in The Pro Shop.

Upcoming Events + Tee Times
Announcements
Clubhouse News
The golf course is coming in nicely with the greens filling out, and the fairways are flush with grass. Please try and stay at the least 30 feet from the greens with all golf carts and 15 feet if you have a handicap flag. Please abide by the 90° rule.
50th Annual Winter Four-Ball from February 16th - 18th, 2024
Mark your calendar on Saturday and Sunday, February 17th - 18th for the 2024 Winter Four-Ball. A practice round will take place Friday, February 16th. Play will consist of two-man teams and best-ball scoring over two days. There will be a Skins game tournament-wide on both days, which is a separate buy-in. There will also be a separate ‘honeypot’ buy-in per day for each flight benefitting the lowest-scoring players.
FLGC Member Updates
Ladies September Tournament:
The Ladies tournament this month will be held on September 23rd starting with 9am ET tee times. The format for this will be Individual Points Event.
Men’s Golf Association:
All MGA Members are eligible for the season ending finale. To be eligible for the cash payout purse during the finale, each MGA member must have played in
six (6) of the eleven (11) total MGA events
. September is the final event of the year before the finale in October. You can check with the golf shop to see how many events you’ve played; we have hard copies of all the events. The September MGA event will take place on the 23rd. This will be an Individual Points Event starting with 8am ET tee times. Please sign up in the Pro Shop.
Couples Event:
This month’s Couple’s Event will be played on Sunday, September 24th starting with a 1pm ET shotgun start. The format for this event will be two-person combined points.
Welcome New Members:
Mr. Jim Barker (Family)
Ms. Cindi Draughn (Single)
Mr. Trevor Sirmans (Associate Couple)
Mr. Randy Smith (Non-Resident Member)
Mr. Corey Waters (Associate Single)

Upcoming Events + Tee Times
Announcements
Clubhouse News
The golf course is coming in nicely with the greens filling out, and the fairways are flush with grass. Please try and stay at the least 30 feet from the greens with all golf carts and 15 feet if you have a handicap flag. Please abide by the 90° rule.
50th Annual Winter Four-Ball from February 16th - 18th, 2024
Mark your calendar on Saturday and Sunday, February 17th - 18th for the 2024 Winter Four-Ball. A practice round will take place Friday, February 16th. Play will consist of two-man teams and best-ball scoring over two days. There will be a Skins game tournament-wide on both days, which is a separate buy-in. There will also be a separate ‘honeypot’ buy-in per day for each flight benefitting the lowest-scoring players.
FLGC Member Updates
Ladies September Tournament:
The Ladies tournament this month will be held on September 23rd starting with 9am ET tee times. The format for this will be Individual Points Event.
Men’s Golf Association:
All MGA Members are eligible for the season ending finale. To be eligible for the cash payout purse during the finale, each MGA member must have played in
six (6) of the eleven (11) total MGA events
. September is the final event of the year before the finale in October. You can check with the golf shop to see how many events you’ve played; we have hard copies of all the events. The September MGA event will take place on the 23rd. This will be an Individual Points Event starting with 8am ET tee times. Please sign up in the Pro Shop.
Couples Event:
This month’s Couple’s Event will be played on Sunday, September 24th starting with a 1pm ET shotgun start. The format for this event will be two-person combined points.
Welcome New Members:
Mr. Jim Barker (Family)
Ms. Cindi Draughn (Single)
Mr. Trevor Sirmans (Associate Couple)
Mr. Randy Smith (Non-Resident Member)
Mr. Corey Waters (Associate Single)

Our Roots
At Francis Lake Golf Club, we know a thing or two about humble beginnings, and a whole lot about family. What was once a simple family farm grew from a 9-hole golf course in the mid-1960’s to the beautiful 18-hole club that so many call home today.
Though we are proud of our lush golf course with scenic views, we are even prouder of the true community that has sprung up around it. Look around, and you will see a family that has grown strong roots over the past 49 years.
Since 1997, Francis Lake has been owned and operated by the Leonard family. With a long history of PGA professionals in the family, it only made sense that father and son pair, Jon and JR Leonard, would join forces to cultivate a strong golf community–alongside their own families, too. Today, JR and his wife Allison are proud to honor Jon Sr.’s legacy and passion for the game of golf, and the incomparable community that exists because of it, at Francis Lake.
We hope you’ll see that southern hospitality takes on a new meaning at Francis Lake, from our community outreach and support to our philanthropic efforts and everything in between.
So pull up your golf cart, grab an iced cold Coca-Cola or beer from the Snack Bar, and don’t be a stranger! At Francis Lake, everyone is always welcome.
Father and Son Duo – Jon Sr. and JR
The Leonard Family (L-R) – Pate, Allison, JR, Mary, and Trey
Jon Sr. and Kay Leonard
Our Course
The 18-hole Francis Lake Golf Club in Lake Park, Georgia is a semi-private golf course that opened in 1971. Designed by Willard Byrd, Francis Lake Golf Club measures 6602 yards from the longest tees and has a slope rating of 131 and a 71.8 USGA rating.
The course features 6 sets of tees for different skill levels.
Francis Lake is proudly owned and operated by PGA golf professionals.
The FLGC Team (L-R) – Ryan Parker, Kay Leonard, Allison Leonard, and JR Leonard

Our Roots
At Francis Lake Golf Club, we know a thing or two about humble beginnings, and a whole lot about family. What was once a simple family farm grew from a 9-hole golf course in the mid-1960’s to the beautiful 18-hole club that so many call home today.
Though we are proud of our lush golf course with scenic views, we are even prouder of the true community that has sprung up around it. Look around, and you will see a family that has grown strong roots over the past 49 years.
Since 1997, Francis Lake has been owned and operated by the Leonard family. With a long history of PGA professionals in the family, it only made sense that father and son pair, Jon and JR Leonard, would join forces to cultivate a strong golf community–alongside their own families, too. Today, JR and his wife Allison are proud to honor Jon Sr.’s legacy and passion for the game of golf, and the incomparable community that exists because of it, at Francis Lake.
We hope you’ll see that southern hospitality takes on a new meaning at Francis Lake, from our community outreach and support to our philanthropic efforts and everything in between.
So pull up your golf cart, grab an iced cold Coca-Cola or beer from the Snack Bar, and don’t be a stranger! At Francis Lake, everyone is always welcome.
Father and Son Duo – Jon Sr. and JR
The Leonard Family (L-R) – Pate, Allison, JR, Mary, and Trey
Jon Sr. and Kay Leonard
Our Course
The 18-hole Francis Lake Golf Club in Lake Park, Georgia is a semi-private golf course that opened in 1971. Designed by Willard Byrd, Francis Lake Golf Club measures 6602 yards from the longest tees and has a slope rating of 131 and a 71.8 USGA rating.
The course features 6 sets of tees for different skill levels.
Francis Lake is proudly owned and operated by PGA golf professionals.
The FLGC Team (L-R) – Ryan Parker, Kay Leonard, Allison Leonard, and JR Leonard
